Award.AwardTitle: Travel support for US scientists to attend GR19
Award.AbstractNarration: This award will enable U.S. scientists to attend GR19 (the 19th International Conference for General Relativity and Gravitation) in Mexico City, July 5-9, 2010. The travel funds will allow U.S. researchers, including young researchers, to present their work at the international meeting and learn of new results.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant helped the participation of US researchers in the 19th International Conference in General Relativity and Gravitation (GR19), which took place at the Banamex Conference Center in Mexico City. The "GR" meetings are the longest running regular meetings on general relativity and gravitation. They occur every three years and are organized by the International Society on General Relativity and Gravitation. The society attempts to reach geographic balance, alternating meetings between the US, Europe and other parts of the world. This was the first time the meeting took place in North America since the one in Boulder in 1992. The meetings attract around 500 researchers from all over the world. They are a premier venue for the exchange of ideas and for younger scientists to build up their careers, make contacts with more senior researchers and present their work.

The grant was administered in the following way: a call for applicants was made through email lists that are widely used by researchers in general relativity and gravitation. Fifty three applications were received. A panel of senior US researchers selected 33 recipients whose expenses were partially paid by this grant. This included a mixture of graduate students and faculty members.

Apart from the benefits to the US researchers, hosting a conference of this magnitude in a developing country usually has an important impact in highlighting the importance of basic research to authorities and the public in general and may help the host country transition faster to a more knowledge-based economy.
